thread.title: Tottenham hand trial to Dutch goalkeeper Nick Weegink
thread.title_full: Tottenham hand trial to Dutch goalkeeper Nick Weegink | Daily Mail Online

author: Amitai Winehouse For Mailonline
title: Tottenham hand trial to Dutch goalkeeper Nick Weegink
text:
Tottenham Hotspur have taken 15-year-old Dutch goalkeeper Nick Weegink on trial.
Weegink - who trains at the Keepers School Regio Twente under former Twente stopper Michel Veurink - is to spend a week with the White Hart Lane club as he bids to earn an extended stay at Hotspur Way.
The young goalkeeper drew interest from a number of English sides after footage of him playing was sent to them by former West Bromwich Albion and Ipswich Town midfielder Romeo Zondervan.
Mauricio Pochettino is otherwise engaged in getting his Tottenham side ready to play Gent in the Europa League at Wembley on Thursday
And Spurs moved fastest to offer him an opportunity to train with their youth team.
Weegink spent a year-and-a-half with Twente's academy but currently represents fourth-tier side ATC'65's youth team.
